intro: Plectocephalus cyanoides, commonly known as the blue-headed plectocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
